newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Shares of Taiwan notebook PC makers up.
newsitem.headline: Shares of Taiwan notebook PC makers up.

text.p: Taiwan's notebook computer makers surged at mid-morning on Thursday on expected sound outlook after U.S. chipmaker Intel Corp on Wednesday launched its new Pentium II microprocessors, brokers said.

"Many analysts expect the Intel move, plus its price cutting on old Pentium microprocessors, will ease the original wait-and-see attitude by computer buyers, especially notebook computers," said Michael Hung, an independent senior analyst.
At 0250 GMT, with 70 minutes left, Inventec Corp rose by the daily seven percent limit to T$353 and Compal Electronics gained T$3 or 2.71 percent to T$114.
